item.title: About
item.description: I studied computer science at ETH Zurich and specialized in Information Security during my master studies. Currently, I work as a Digital Forensics Investigator. At SIB, I teach the IT-Security lecture as part of their Chief Digital Officer postgraduate studies. Before, I worked as a Junior Security Engineer at Futurae, an ETH Spin-off where I helped building secure and usable two-factor authentication. I also worked as a Web Engineer at UniversitätsSpital Zürich and ABZ and was the webmaster for bauenschweiz.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Black Hole Service to collect arbitrary HTTP requests to see what your HTTP client is sending, e.g. when debugging webhooks. Source: github.com/passuf/blackhole Browser Fingerprint Research project to demonstrate how much data a browser reveals by just visiting a website. Demo: passuf.github.io/browser-fingerprint Source: github.com/passuf/browser-fingerprint FlatDist Finding the optimal place for your new flat can be a pain, so I wrote a small tool to calculate distances from any address (your potential new home?
